title: Can Sorcery get reworked more specially for mages season 9?
body: What I mean is to remove all this moves speed runes for bruiser, add it to precision or resolve, and make more mage specific runes for actual mages? So we don't have to share our tree with everyone else?

Positioning and such are core of Aurelion's play pattern but overall if you learn how to play you don't need PR and time to time it's even detrimental as you end up being so fast at chasing that you have to get back a bit and this back&forth movements in order not to lose your target and not giving them a huge chance at retailate.

I don't have experience on him, so genuinely asking: If it is a lesser evil kind of choice, why can't he go Electrocute instead?
It has the same activation pattern and adds damage, something that he probably values.

So if it has the same pattern, doesn't that mean he gets more out of the MS than of the damage?

I personally experimented a bit with him and found out that Electrocute was useful only as a snowballer in matchups I could have won easily even without, plus the other runes of the tree don't really help him (especially since they removed {{item:3030}} from his core build). 

Overall he had become more and more dependant on the Inspiration tree because of the tonic rune because {{item:2033}} is a must pick as starter and not taking that rune makes your early game really heavy.

If you claim that Vladimir never takes it, with 13% pickrate on him, then no, you can't argue that Darius takes it, since he just uses it 10% of the time.

Viktor, granted, doesn't use it anymore with the whole tank Viktor stuff going on. When I am going Viktor mid, I always take this rune to escape better and being able to chase enemies with my ult.

Point still stands, majority of champions using it are mages, not bruisers.

Optimal choices aren't the only choices. Just because Comet may be "better" doesn't mean that Aery, Electrocute, and Phase Rush don't all have their niches?

Also what bruisers take sorcery, save Xin? There are some very strange darius builds using it, but I haven't seen it used in ages.

Trees can have more than one audience as well. 8 of the runes are obviously made for mid mages, and considering that Adcs have 9, it doesn't really seem that bad in comparison.

**Sorcery is not meant to be strictly for mages and never was.**

Yes, a lot of mages go straight to Sorcery and need variety, but each tree is meant to support more than one class, whether the tree be primary or secondary.

Precision is not just "the on-hit tree"; it has all sorts of runes that are helpful in loads of combat situations.

Domination is not just "the assassin tree"; it has a lot of things to help any number of champions that roam the map, such as supports and junglers in general.

Resolve is not just "the tank tree"; loads of champs regardless of stats can make great use of defenses, particularly bruisers.

Don't even get me started on Inspiration.

Similarly, Sorcery's non-mage users should not be restricted from taking it primary or secondary because mages don't have enough variety. If anything, other trees should give them more options to do their jobs better other than just "more damage". Sorcery has enough variety; others (particularly Domination) need to branch out.
